message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the natural lifecycle of animals. When a squirrel dies in either the spring or the fall, its body would undergo decomposition. Option (A) is incorrect because a glowing corpse is not a natural occurrence. Option (C) is incorrect because melting does not happen to animal corpses. Option (D) is incorrect because corpses do not fly.

This question requires knowledge about the process of decomposition. When an organism, like a squirrel, dies, its body decomposes over time. Option (A) is incorrect because a glowing corpse is not a natural occurrence. Option (C) is also incorrect because a corpse does not melt. Option (D) is unrealistic as corpses cannot fly. Option (B) is the correct answer as decomposition is the natural process that occurs after death.
